intro: Lisianthius tatei, commonly known as the Hawaiian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate and soil conditions of Hawaii. Its small, showy flowers bloom in shades of white and yellow, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, Lisianthius tatei is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
